summary: Amazon India Seller Opportunity Finder - a full-stack web application for identifying high-demand, low-competition, high-margin products on Amazon.in with real-time data analysis, opportunity scoring, profit calculations, and trend detection across all Amazon India categories
architectural_notes: React/Next.js frontend with Tailwind CSS and Chart.js for visualization
Node.js or Python backend with scraping engine and daily scheduler
PostgreSQL or MongoDB for data storage with Redis caching
Ethical scraping implementation with rotation and captcha handling if API unavailable
Real-time data processing optimized for <3 sec search response time
Scalable architecture to handle millions of Amazon.in products
India-specific business logic for GST, fees, and buying behavior
known_issues: Version 14: ASIN values are incorrect or inaccurate
Version 14: Product prices are incorrect or inaccurate
Version 14: Actual product names are not being displayed

existing_features.title: Support all Amazon.in product categories including: Electronics, Home & Kitchen, Beauty, Grocery, Fashion, Automotive, Industrial, Toys, Baby, Health, Books, Pet Supplies, Office, Sports, Handmade, Luxury, and emerging categories with category filter and subcategory drill-down navigation

Create advanced filtering system allowing users to filter by: price range (₹), rating threshold (< 4 stars), review count (< 200), BSR range, monthly revenue range, product weight (with lightweight preference), non-branded/private label friendly flag, low FBA seller count, high review growth in last 30 days, and high margin threshold (>30%)

Build keyword research module displaying: search volume estimate, keyword difficulty score, CPC (cost-per-click) estimate, 12-month trend graph, long-tail keyword suggestions, and auto-suggest functionality derived from Amazon search patterns

Create India-specific profit calculator that computes: Amazon referral fees, FBA fees, GST consideration, shipping cost, packaging cost, and ads budget; outputs net profit per unit, ROI percentage, and break-even ACOS (Advertising Cost of Sale)

Build competitor analysis page that displays top 10 sellers for a selected product showing: average price, average rating, average reviews, listing quality score, and weakness detection (poor images, bad keywords, low review count, high price)

Design modern dashboard UI with dark mode support featuring: category heatmap visualization, opportunity leaderboard, sortable product lists (by highest score, highest revenue, lowest competition, highest growth), and interactive charts including revenue bar charts, BSR trend lines, review growth graphs, and margin breakdown visualizations

Implement seller alerts notification system that triggers alerts for: new high-opportunity products discovered, sudden drops in competition levels, trending keyword emergence, and seasonal demand spikes

Create monetization tier system with Free plan (limited searches per day), Pro plan, and Premium plan; include features for data export to CSV, saved product lists, and email alert delivery for paid tiers

Design product display card format showing: Product Name, Category, Price, Estimated Sales, Revenue, Competition Level, Opportunity Score (1-100), Net Margin, Trend Status, and Recommendation indicator (YES/AVOID/MODERATE)

Optimize application for Indian seller needs by handling GST pricing structure, considering Indian buying behavior patterns in algorithms, ensuring scalability for millions of product records, and maintaining search response time under 3 seconds

Debug and fix the advanced filters in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts and frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to ensure filtered products are correctly returned and displayed when any filter criteria (price range, rating threshold, review count, BSR range, monthly revenue range, lightweight preference, non-branded flag, low FBA seller count, high review growth, high margin threshold) is applied

Verify that the useQueries.ts hook's searchProducts mutation correctly passes filter parameters to the backend actor and that the backend main.mo searchProducts method properly filters products based on all provided criteria including price range, rating threshold, review count limits, BSR range, revenue estimates, weight preferences, and boolean flags

Add console logging or debug output in the ProductGrid component and useProductFilters hook to trace filter application, including the active filter state, number of products before filtering, number after filtering, and any errors encountered during the filtering process

Investigate and fix the ProductGrid component in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to ensure products are displayed when filters are applied, checking that the filteredProducts array is correctly populated and passed to the rendering logic

Debug the useProductFilters hook in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to verify filter state is correctly managed and applied, ensuring all filter parameters (category, price range, rating threshold, review count, BSR range, monthly revenue range, lightweight preference, non-branded flag, low FBA seller count, high review growth, high margin threshold) are properly tracked and used

Verify the searchProducts mutation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts correctly passes all filter parameters to the backend actor and handles the response properly, ensuring the returned products are accessible to components

Add comprehensive console logging throughout the filter flow including: filter state changes in useProductFilters, filter parameters sent to backend in useQueries, products received from backend, and filtered products array in ProductGrid component to enable debugging of the filter issue

Ensure the AdvancedFilters component in frontend/src/components/AdvancedFilters.tsx correctly triggers filter updates and that all filter inputs properly update the filter state in useProductFilters hook

Add comprehensive try-catch error handling in the searchProducts mutation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to capture and log the actual error details from the backend, including error type, message, and stack trace

Add detailed console logging in the ProductGrid component in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx before and after filter application, logging the raw products array length, filtered products array length, active filter state, and any errors during rendering

Add debug logging in the useProductFilters hook in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to log every filter state change, including the parameter name, old value, new value, and complete filter object after update

Add detailed logging in the AdvancedFilters component in frontend/src/components/AdvancedFilters.tsx when the Apply button is clicked, logging all local filter values being applied and confirmation that the filter hook was updated

Verify and fix the data type handling for bigint fields (reviewCountMax, bsrRange) in the searchProducts mutation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to ensure they are correctly serialized and sent to the backend actor

Add a detailed error display component in the ProductGrid that shows the actual error message and filter state when 'Something went wrong!' occurs, replacing the generic error alert with specific debugging information

Investigate and resolve the 'Something went wrong!' error appearing in the draft preview by examining the ProductGrid component's error handling logic, the searchProducts query response handling in useQueries.ts, and the backend searchProducts method to identify the root cause of the failure

Add fallback error recovery in the ProductGrid component in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to handle cases where the searchProducts query fails, displaying a user-friendly error message with actionable troubleshooting steps instead of the generic 'Something went wrong!' message

Add initialization error detection in the useActor hook in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts to catch and report cases where the backend actor fails to initialize or becomes unavailable, which could cause the 'Something went wrong!' error
Remove the TikTok analytics script tag (analytics.tiktok.com) from frontend/index.html that is causing ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT errors and preventing the application from loading
Verify frontend/index.html contains no other external third-party analytics or tracking scripts that could cause similar loading failures
Add error boundaries around external script loading to prevent future third-party script failures from crashing the entire application

Convert BigInt values (reviewCountMax, bsrRange) to Number type before sending to backend in the searchProducts mutation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to resolve the 'Do not know how to serialize a BigInt' error

Update the useProductFilters hook in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to store and manage reviewCountMax and bsrRange as Number type instead of BigInt to prevent serialization issues throughout the application
Add error boundary protection in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to catch and log BigInt serialization errors with specific troubleshooting guidance before they crash the application

Audit all filter state initialization and updates in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to identify where BigInt values are still being created or stored, and ensure all numeric filter values (reviewCountMax, bsrRange.min, bsrRange.max, monthlyRevenueRange.min, monthlyRevenueRange.max) are explicitly typed and handled as Number throughout the hook's lifecycle

Add explicit Number() type conversion guards in the AdvancedFilters component in frontend/src/components/AdvancedFilters.tsx for all numeric input values before they are passed to the filter state update functions, ensuring input values from number fields are coerced to Number type

Trace and fix the BigInt creation source by adding pre-serialization validation in the searchProducts mutation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts that checks filter parameter types and logs detailed type information (typeof, constructor.name) for reviewCountMax and all bsrRange/monthlyRevenueRange fields immediately before the backend actor call

Add defensive Number conversion wrapper immediately before the actor.searchProducts() call in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts that explicitly converts all numeric fields in the filter object (reviewCountMax, bsrRange.min, bsrRange.max, monthlyRevenueRange.min, monthlyRevenueRange.max) to Number type as a final safeguard

Search the entire frontend codebase for any BigInt literal syntax (e.g., 200n, 5000n) or BigInt() constructor calls and replace them with regular Number literals or Number() conversions to eliminate any remaining BigInt creation points

Add runtime type inspection logging in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts searchProducts mutation that logs the exact typeof and constructor.name for every numeric field in the filters object (reviewCountMax, bsrRange.min, bsrRange.max, monthlyRevenueRange.min, monthlyRevenueRange.max, priceRange.min, priceRange.max) immediately before the actor.searchProducts() call, and add a recursive object inspector that traverses the entire filters object to detect any BigInt values anywhere in the structure

Add a sanitization function in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts that recursively walks the entire filters object structure and forcefully converts any BigInt values to Number, then apply this sanitization immediately before actor.searchProducts() to create a guaranteed BigInt-free copy of the filters

Inspect the getBackendFilters() function in frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx that converts Number to BigInt and verify it is not being called or referenced anywhere in the filter application flow, as this may be the source of BigInt values being reintroduced into the filters

Add a JSON.stringify() pre-flight test in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts immediately before the actor.searchProducts() call that attempts to serialize the filters object and catches any serialization errors, logging the exact field and value that caused the failure with detailed error information

Review the session storage persistence logic in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to verify that stored filter values are not being deserialized as BigInt when read from session storage, and add explicit Number() conversion when loading filters from storage

Debug the searchProducts query in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to verify it successfully fetches products from the backend, logging the query status (loading, success, error), response data structure, and product count returned

Fix the ProductGrid component in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to correctly render products from the searchProducts query result, verifying the data path from query response to the map function that renders ProductCard components

Add comprehensive debugging logs in ProductGrid component in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx at render time showing: query.isLoading state, query.isError state, query.data structure, products array length, and first product object if available

Test the complete data flow by temporarily hardcoding a simple filter-free searchProducts call in ProductGrid component, bypassing the filter system entirely, to isolate whether the issue is with filtering logic or core data fetching

Fix the serialization error 'Cannot serialize filter fields: reviewCountMax, bsrRange' displayed on the filter page by ensuring all numeric filter fields (reviewCountMax, bsrRange.min, bsrRange.max, monthlyRevenueRange values) are serialized as Number type, not BigInt, throughout the entire data flow from AdvancedFilters component through useProductFilters hook to useQueries searchProducts mutation

Add pre-submission validation in the AdvancedFilters component's Apply button handler that checks all numeric inputs (Max Reviews: 300, BSR: 15-2000, Revenue: ₹70000-₹500000) and explicitly converts them to Number type before updating the filter state, preventing any BigInt or string values from entering the filter pipeline

Inspect and fix the data type handling in the useProductFilters hook's session storage deserialization logic to ensure that when filter values are loaded from sessionStorage, all numeric fields (reviewCountMax, bsrRange.min, bsrRange.max, monthlyRevenueRange.min, monthlyRevenueRange.max) are explicitly parsed as Number type, not BigInt

Add runtime type checking immediately before the searchProducts actor call in useQueries.ts that validates all numeric fields in the filters object are of type 'number' (not 'bigint' or 'string'), and if any non-number types are detected, log a detailed warning with the field name and type, then force convert to Number before proceeding with the actor call

Update the error display on the filter page to show recovery options (Retry button and Clear Filters button as shown in image-4.png are working) and verify these buttons successfully reset the filter state and allow users to recover from the serialization error without requiring a full page refresh

Add comprehensive console logging in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx at component render to log: query.isLoading boolean, query.isError boolean, query.error object (if present), query.data structure, products array existence and length, and first product object details if array is non-empty

Verify the searchProducts query in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts is receiving a successful response from the backend by adding detailed logging of: query execution start, filter parameters being sent, raw response from actor.searchProducts(), response data structure, and any caught errors during the query

Fix the data path in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to correctly extract the products array from the searchProducts query response, verifying the response structure matches what the component expects (e.g., query.data vs query.data.products vs query.data.ok with nested products array)

Add a temporary hardcoded test in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx that bypasses the searchProducts query entirely and renders a static array of 3 mock products to isolate whether the issue is with data fetching or rendering logic

Add default/fallback product data directly in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts searchProducts query that returns at least 5 mock products if the backend call fails or returns empty results, allowing the UI to display sample data for testing

Debug and fix the filter application logic in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx to ensure that when filters are applied through the AdvancedFilters component, the product list is correctly filtered and updated, verifying that the searchProducts query is triggered with the correct filter parameters

Verify and fix the data flow between AdvancedFilters component in frontend/src/components/AdvancedFilters.tsx and the useProductFilters hook in frontend/src/hooks/useProductFilters.ts to ensure filter state updates are correctly propagated when the Apply button is clicked

Add comprehensive debugging output in frontend/src/components/ProductGrid.tsx that logs the filter application process including: active filters state, searchProducts query parameters being sent, query execution status, number of products returned, and whether filters were successfully applied to the displayed results

Verify the searchProducts query implementation in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts correctly handles the filter parameter conversion and ensures the backend actor call is made with properly formatted filter values, adding defensive type checking and conversion for all numeric fields before the actor call
Update ProductCard component in frontend/src/components/ProductCard.tsx to display the ASIN field prominently, adding it near the product title or category information
Ensure the product name/title is displayed prominently as the primary heading in ProductCard component in frontend/src/components/ProductCard.tsx
Update the Product type definition in frontend type declarations to include asin and productName/title fields, ensuring type safety across the frontend

Verify that the ProductCard component in frontend/src/components/ProductCard.tsx is correctly reading and displaying the productName field from the Product data structure, ensuring the actual product name appears as the primary heading instead of placeholder or missing text

new_feature_requests.summary: Real-time Amazon.in data scraping/API integration with product details, BSR, and sales estimates
Proprietary Opportunity Score algorithm (1-100) based on demand, competition, growth, and margin potential
Category coverage for all Amazon.in segments with filter and drill-down capability
Advanced filtering system (price, rating, reviews, BSR, revenue, weight, margin, seller type)
Keyword research module with search volume, difficulty, CPC, trends, and long-tail suggestions
Trend detection system for review growth, price increases, seasonal spikes, and Rising Star badges
India-specific profit calculator with Amazon fees, FBA, GST, shipping, packaging, and ads ROI
Competitor analysis page with top sellers, weakness detection, and listing quality scoring
Modern dashboard UI with dark mode, heatmaps, leaderboards, charts, and multi-sort capabilities
Seller alerts system for new opportunities, competition drops, trending keywords, and seasonal spikes
Monetization tiers (Free/Pro/Premium) with data export, saved lists, and email alerts
Bonus features: AI suggestions, private label scoring, brand domination detection, capital estimation, India sourcing hints

Create backend data model for storing Amazon.in product information including: product title, category, subcategory, price, MRP, rating, number of reviews, BSR (Best Seller Rank), seller type (FBA/Easy Ship/Seller Fulfilled), brand, estimated monthly sales, and stock availability

Implement proprietary Opportunity Score algorithm (1-100 scale) calculated as: (Demand Score × Growth Score × Margin Potential) ÷ Competition Score, where Demand Score is based on BSR, review velocity, and sales estimate; Competition Score considers number of sellers, average reviews, brand dominance, and sponsored listing density; Growth Score tracks trending keywords, recent review spikes, and price growth; Margin Potential calculates selling price minus Amazon fees and estimated sourcing cost

Implement trend detection system that identifies: products with sudden review growth spikes, price increase trends, seasonal demand patterns, and automatically assigns 'Rising Star' badge to qualifying products

Add bonus advanced features including: AI-generated suggestion explaining why each product is a good opportunity, private label suitability score, brand domination detection, market saturation warnings, estimated capital required calculation, and India sourcing suggestions with local manufacturer hints

Review and fix the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo to ensure it correctly applies all filter criteria and returns matching products, checking that the filtering logic handles all parameters including price range, rating threshold, review count limits, BSR range, revenue estimates, weight preferences, and boolean flags

Add detailed error handling in the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo to catch and return specific error messages when filter operations fail, including parameter validation errors, data type conversion errors, and filtering logic errors

Fix the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo to ensure null/None filter values are handled gracefully and do not cause filtering to fail, treating null values as 'no constraint' for that filter parameter
Verify that the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo returns a valid response structure even when no filters are applied, ensuring the default case returns all products without errors

Verify the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo returns sample products when called without filters, ensuring the method has mock/seed data available and returns it in the correct response format expected by the frontend

Verify the useActor hook in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts successfully initializes the backend actor and that actor.searchProducts is a callable function, adding error handling for actor initialization failures
Check if the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo is correctly exported and accessible through the actor interface, verifying the method signature matches what the frontend expects

Verify the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo contains sample/mock product data that can be returned when called without filters or with minimal filters, ensuring at least 10-20 mock products are available for testing

Verify the backend actor initialization in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts is successful and that actor.searchProducts exists as a callable function, adding console logging when actor is created/changed and explicit error handling if actor or searchProducts method is undefined

Audit and correct the product data accuracy in the mock/sample data returned by the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo, ensuring realistic and consistent values for price, estimated sales, revenue, margin, rating, and review counts that align with Amazon.in marketplace patterns

Fix the margin calculation logic in backend/main.mo to ensure margin percentages are accurately computed based on product price, estimated costs, and Amazon fees, replacing the currently incorrect 0.3% margin shown for all products with realistic values between 20-40% for high-opportunity products

Enhance the backend searchProducts method in backend/main.mo to implement proper filtering logic that respects all filter parameters (price range, rating threshold, review count max, BSR range, revenue range) and returns only products that match all active filter criteria

Update the product mock data generation in backend/main.mo to create at least 50 diverse sample products across multiple categories (Electronics, Home & Kitchen, Food Storage) with varied price points (₹30-₹500), realistic sales estimates (100-2000 units/month), accurate revenue calculations, diverse margin percentages (10-45%), and varied ratings (3.8-4.9) to enable meaningful filter testing
Add ASIN (Amazon Standard Identification Number) and Product name fields to the product data model and display in the UI
Add ASIN field to the Product type in backend/main.mo, storing it as a Text value (10-character alphanumeric Amazon identifier)
Add productName field to the Product type in backend/main.mo if not already present, ensuring it stores the full product title

Audit and fix the ASIN field values in the mock product data returned by backend/main.mo searchProducts method to ensure all ASINs are valid 10-character alphanumeric Amazon identifiers (e.g., B08N5WRWNW, B09G9FPHY6) instead of placeholder or incorrect values

Audit and fix the price field values in the mock product data in backend/main.mo to ensure prices are accurate, realistic, and consistent with the product category and type, using actual Amazon.in marketplace pricing patterns (e.g., ₹299 for kitchen containers, ₹1499 for electronics, ₹499 for fashion items)

Update the mock product data in backend/main.mo to include realistic, detailed product names for each item that match their category and specifications (e.g., 'Borosil Glass Food Storage Container Set 500ml - Pack of 4', 'boAt Airdopes 141 Bluetooth Truly Wireless in Ear Earbuds', 'Safari Thorium 55 Cms Hardsided Check-in Luggage')

Add data validation logging in backend/main.mo searchProducts method that verifies each product object contains valid non-empty values for productName, asin, and price fields before returning the results, logging any products with missing or invalid data
